section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-0994712 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Due to the COVID-19 health crisis and Ohio’s stay at home orders, the April 20th Hardin-Houston Board of Education meeting will be conducted as a virtual board meeting. The IDEA portion of the meeting will start at 6:45 PM with the regular scheduled board meeting starting at 7:00 PM. If you are interested in accessing the link to this meeting please email Ryan Maier, Hardin-Houston Superintendent at rmaier@hardinhouston.org. Thank you!

Meal deliveries will resume this Friday, April 17th following our normal Tuesday/Friday delivery schedule. The open enrollment online forms for new and returning students will be accessible starting this Friday using the OneView tab located on the school website by going to “School Information > Registration & Forms” or by clicking here. Please be sure to fill out the correct form based upon your new or returning open enrollment status for next school year. Directions for OneView have been provided on the OneView page for both new and returning users. Students, keep up the great work! Our entire H-H staff misses you and looks forward to seeing you soon! Go Wildcats!

h4.span: Week 4 Meal, Online Instruction, Spring Break Information

div.p: Hi again Wildcat students, parents, and community members. This short message includes changes and updates for food delivery and online instruction for Week 4 in addition to Spring break information. Food will be delivered to those students by bus this Thursday, April 9th instead of the normal Friday delivery date. The aides will be handing out, using social distancing, six days of meals that will cover students through Thursday, April 16th. The district will return to our regular food delivery schedule on Friday, April 17th. The second important announcement is that our Spring break is still scheduled for this coming Friday and Monday. It should be noted that there will be no online instruction during this 4-day period. Teachers will not be assigning any work or instructing students during this time frame and there will be no expectation of student work being completed during this established time. Please get away from those screens and enjoy time with your family. We will resume online instruction on Tuesday, April 14th. Have a relaxing Spring break! Go Wildcats!
Click the link below for Ohio’s Stay At Home Wellness Kit for Parents. It was developed in Ohio in response to the current stay-at-home order for parents and the at home schooling they are enduring.

Registration is now open for the annual Conservation Day Camp. The camp will take place this summer from June 23-25th and is open to students currently in 2nd-5th grade. Registration is taken on a first-come, first-serve basis until May 15th, or registration is full. For more information and the registration form, click here.

p.span: Hello again parents, students, and community members, I have a few new updates for you as we enter week 3 of online instruction for all of our Hardin-Houston Wildcat students. Yesterday, Governor Mike DeWine announced that schools would continue to be closed thru Friday, May 1st, and with that our hard-working staff will continue to provide quality online instruction combined with unique projects for our Wildcats to complete. We are so thankful for the effort our kids are demonstrating during these challenging times in addition to the support, homework help, and structure our parents are giving to them during the evenings when their personal workday has ended. I would also like to inform you that both principals, Mr. Judy and Mrs. Roseberry and our athletic director, Mr. Knouff are constantly looking at potential reschedule dates for all major activities and events that have been postponed so far this spring based upon the premise that restrictions will be lifted in the near future. The district’s administration fully understands the importance that these events play in our student’s lives and will do our best to afford them these high school experiences. Take care of yourself and Go Wildcats!
